Event.name: Reshaping
Event.definition:
<def-root>In this frame a <fen>Deformer</fen> deforms a <fen>Patient</fen> possibly against a <fen>Resistant_surface</fen> such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the <fen>Configuration</fen>, a new shape. Some of these words indicate that the <fen>Configuration</fen> is an undesirable alteration of the norm, and in such cases the lexical unit is marked with the semantic type Negative_judgement. This frame does not include senses that specifically indicate causing harm to a living being.
<ex><fex name="Def">Ellen</fex> <t>crumpled</t> <fex name="Patient">the paper</fex> <fex name="Configuration">into a ball</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Def">Michael</fex> <t>flattened</t> <fex name="Patient">the can</fex> <fex name="Resistant_surface">against his head</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Mix butter and sardines very thoroughly , <t>mashing</t> <fex name="Patient">them</fex> <fex name="Ins">with a fork</fex> <fex name="Configuration">until you have a smooth paste</fex>. <fex name="Def">CNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Cause">A killer hurricane</fex> <fex name="Mnr">nearly</fex> <t>flattened</t> <fex name="Patient">Sylvester Stallone's five luxury homes in Hawaii</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Deformer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Deformer</fen> is the one who does the reshaping.
<ex><fex name="Def">The lieutenant</fex> <t>crushed</t> it angrily with his boot before looking back at Hencke.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which the <fen>Deformer</fen> affects the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The lieutenant <t>crushed</t> it angrily <fex name="Ins">with his boot</fex> before looking back at Hencke.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Manner</fen> identifies the manner in which an <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The lieutenant <t>crushed</t> it <fex name="Mnr">angrily</fex> with his boot before looking back at Hencke.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Means</fen> identifies the means by which the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change. <ex>Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , <t>crushing</t> <fex name="Patient">it</fex> into a pulp.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>What 's more , when you 've finished with it simply wipe it clean and then <t>fold</t> it flat<fex name="Purp"> for easy storage</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The lieutenant <t>crushed</t> it angrily with his boot <fex name="Time">before looking back at Hencke</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> is the shape the <fen>Patient</fen> becomes. <ex>Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , <t>crushing</t> it <fex name="Result">into a pulp</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Resistant_surface
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Resistant_surface</fen> is the surface against which a <fen>Deformer</fen> presses the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>Michael <t>flattened</t> the can <fex name="Res_surf">against his head</fex> . </ex> <ex>She <t>crushed</t> her cigarette <fex name="Res_surf">in the ashtray</fex> and stood up to go.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Locus
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Locus</fen> is the locus of the reshaping action; it is essentially a simultaneous <fen>Instrument</fen> and <fen>Resistant_surface</fen>.
<ex>Russell <t>crumpled</t> the paper cups <fex name="Locus">in his fist</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s. <ex><fex name="Cause">The strong winds</fex> <t>deformed</t> the structure of the outhouse.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cause">The rockslide</fex> <t>squashed</t> our summer villa.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Iterations</fen> indicates the number of times the reshaping has occurred.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> indicates a state of affairs that the <fen>Deformer</fen> is responding to in performing the reshaping. </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Patient</fen> is reshaped. <ex>The steamroller <t>flattened</t> my shoes <fex name="Degr">completely</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion
Arg.definition: <def-root>The part of the <fen>Patient</fen> which is directly affected by the reshaping. <ex>He <t>warped</t> the steering rack <fex name="Subr">on the left side</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location that the <fen>Patient</fen> ends up in.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The conditions under which the <fen>Patient</fen> is shaped. <ex><fex name="Cause">The machine</fex> <t>crushed</t> <fex name="Patient">rocks</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">in the baking heat</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Imposed_purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Patient</fen> with respect to the change that the <fen>Deformer</fen> brings about by making the adjustment. <ex>You should <t>fold</t> the contraption <fex name="imp">to fit in the bag</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Configuration
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state that holds of the <fen>Patient</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Patient</fen> as a result of the arranging action.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: scrunch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: crush or squeeze into a compact mass.

lexUnit.name: crumple.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: crush or become crushed so as to become creased and wrinkled

lexUnit.name: dent.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to have a slight hollow indentation

lexUnit.name: squash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: crush or squeeze (something)so that it becomes flat, soft, or out of shape.

lexUnit.name: crush.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deform by compressing forcefully or crease or crumple (cloth or paper)

lexUnit.name: warp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to become bent or twisted out of shape, typically from the action of heat or damp.

lexUnit.name: roll.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: flatten (something) by passing a roller over it or by passing it between rollers.

lexUnit.name: fold.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bend (something) over on itself so that one part of it covers another.

lexUnit.name: form.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause something to have a certain form

lexUnit.name: shape.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to form into a shape

lexUnit.name: mold.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to reshape something pliable, especially by pressing with the hands, often against a mould

lexUnit.name: deformation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: causing something to change from its original shape, usually with negative consequences

lexUnit.name: bend.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to apply force to something causing it to become curved

lexUnit.name: launch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to smooth the surface of something

lexUnit.name: curl.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: form into a coil, or curved shape.
